body_html:
I want to caculate the Kronecker product of two matrix, and
tf.reshape(matrix_A, [2,1,2,1]) * tf.reshape(matrix_B, [1,3,1,3]) raised the above UnimpementedError.
I circumvented this broadcasting by using tf.tile to explictly broadcast this two matrix.

Is there an easy way to do this broadcasting in tensorflow, like in Numpy?

Update:
I find tf.transpose can do things like dimshuffle in theano, so the problems above can be handled by combination of shuffle and broadcasting.
body_text:
I want to caculate the Kronecker product of two matrix, and
tf.reshape(matrix_A, [2,1,2,1]) * tf.reshape(matrix_B, [1,3,1,3]) raised the above UnimpementedError.
I circumvented this broadcasting by using tf.tile to explictly broadcast this two matrix.
Is there an easy way to do this broadcasting in tensorflow, like in Numpy?
Update:
I find tf.transpose can do things like dimshuffle in theano, so the problems above can be handled by combination of shuffle and broadcasting.
body:
I want to caculate the Kronecker product of two matrix, and 
tf.reshape(matrix_A, [2,1,2,1]) \* tf.reshape(matrix_B, [1,3,1,3]) raised the above UnimpementedError.
I circumvented this broadcasting by using tf.tile to explictly broadcast this two matrix. 

Is there an easy way to do this broadcasting in tensorflow, like in Numpy?

Update:
I find tf.transpose can do things like dimshuffle in theano, so the problems above can be handled by combination of shuffle and broadcasting.
